ANU.name: Xianming Zhou
interest: Executive compensation, managerial incentive contracts, capital market
ANU.biography: Dr. Zhou's research interest is in corporate finance, managerial incentives, and capital market. The modern corporation is characterized by the separation of ownership and control, and not surprisingly, many hotly debated issues in the finance literature root in the agency relationship between shareholders and managers in publicly held companies. Xianming's recent research involves applications of agency theory to corporate governance issues and related empirical tests using executive compensation and firm performance data.
